content: This is a test for a new automation.
I intentionally did not write the PR number, #24465 in the previous message.
When I read hammer as the emoji name, I was expecting something different...

@Michael Rothgang I wonder whether the issue is that the PR has awaiting-author as a label as well and the bot applies a reaction based on one of the labels, rather than the most recently added label.

For the record: when I added the maintainer-merge label to the PR in question, the bot added the emoji reaction that you see I also gave to both the first message and the one with the PR number.

Those two messages were indeed the intended target, the kind of emoji was just the unexpected one.

When I then removed the maintainer-merge label, the bot undid its first action: this is good, except that we would have wanted the action to be different in the first place!

Yet another test: I removed the awaiting-review label on the PR, added the maintainer-merge PR and the emoji reaction was still the same.
Maybe hammer really does mean writing...
#24554 fixes a syntax error in the workflow file
